description: This 1972 Chevelle SS Tribute is a nice driver quality car.  The 454 Big Block runs well and the Turbo 350 Automatic transmission shifts well. Equipped with power steering, power front disc brakes, and  he aftermarket 17'' US Mag Wheels give it a very good look and stance while fun to drive.  The paint is starting to show its age with a few blemishes throughout but still has a great look for you to bring to your local roll ins and shows or just enjoy on the weekends.  Trades and Offers will be considered.  Call 507-386-1726 for more information.

1971 Chevrolet Chevelle 350, Automatic, Working AC, Power Steering and Power Disc Brakes.  Runs, drives and sounds as good as it looks.  Beautiful professionally done custom paint with ghost Super Sport stripes with hint of flames on the hood.  Custom upgraded modern stereo system with sound suppressing insulation.  This is one of the nicest complete cars we have ever had.  A fantastic show quality car that can be driven anywhere.  Call Kent 713-703-0674 or Frank 281-855-4444
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mHydILoE7d8
Walk around videos, driving videos and more pictures are available upon request.
We also offer financing through various lenders.
SUCCESSFUL BIDDERS

The winning bidder must contact us within 24 hours to proceed with payment and delivery arrangements.  We will be glad to assist in shipping but it is the buyer's responsibility. DEPOSIT The winning bidder must submit the non refundable deposit within 24 hours of the close of the auction to secure the vehicle. PAYMENT METHODS Our preferred method of payment is bank wire transfer, or 3rd party financing. We can work with you if that is a problem. All funds must be in US dollars only. Please be sure to have full payment or approved financing in place before making your final bid. Feel free to call us with any questions. PAYMENT OF BALANCE DUE The buyer agrees to pay remaining balance due within 7 days of the close of the auction. All financial transactions must be completed before the vehicle leaves our dealership. TAX, TITLE AND LICENSE. A clear title will be released along with the vehicle on receipt of funds. Texas residents are responsible for sales tax in our state. Non-Texas residents are responsible for paying taxes in his/her state.
If sold in Texas, the vehicle will be registered with Antique Plates unless other arrangements are made prior to sale.

SHIPPING The buyer is responsible for all shipping charges. We can refer you to a number of trusted national and international shippers. ATTENTION BUYERS This vehicle is being sold as is, where is, with no warranty expressed, written or implied. The seller shall not be responsible for the correct description, authenticity, genuine, or defects herein, and makes no warranty in connection therewith. Although every effort is made on our part to accurately describe vehicle, it is the buyers responsibility to see that his/her classic and collector car purchase meets their individual criteria. Any descriptions or representations are for identification purposes only and are not to be construed as a warranty of any type. The seller will make every effort to disclose any known defects associated with the vehicle at the buyers request prior to the close of the sale. Seller assumes no responsibility for any oral or written statements about the vehicle. A personal or 3rd party inspection prior to purchase is highly recommended.
Incredible "SuperCar" Concur Quality that would cost $150,000+ to duplicate
Triple Black "Bad A" Convertible with AC, full power and 656 Ponies
Exterior: Black with White hood and trunk racing stripes (painted)
Interior: Incredible custom interior (receipt for $14,000)
Convertible top: Black with glass rear window
Convertible top boot: Black
Mileage: less than 1,000 miles since complete build
Serial number: 13667B229777
As the saying goes....."This dog can hunt!"
This car received a professional & very expensive chassis off detailed restoration
Engine
502 CID Chevrolet GM purchased from Freisen Chevrolet,Sutton,NE.
Cylinder heads: Brodix aluminum with large intake & exhaust valves/large oval ports
and Brodix SBC tall valve covers
Induction system
RamJet Fuel injection with larger 50lbs injectors & Cowl induction
and special air-cleaner.
Crankshaft: Forged steel crankshaft
Camshaft:roller
Rocker arms: Roller
Compression ratio: 9.6:1 so you can run on the street with 92 Octane
Transmission
4/speed 700R automatic built by Art Carr transmissions with 3000rpm stall converter
with Shift-Works shifter
Oil cooler Transmission saver
Air conditioning system
All new, modern and blows ice cold
Rear end
2 Bolt H/D Posi-traction with 3:73 gears
Cooling system
Griffith hi-capacity radiator with dual cooling fans and
overflow safety "catch" system, aluminum hi-capacity water pump
Exhaust system
New aluminized exhaust manifolds and 2.5" Aluminized exhaust pipes from front
to back
Suspension
New upper & lower A arms & bushing
New inner and outer tie rods
New adjustable sleeve idler arms
New upper/lower ball joints
New end link kit
Brakes
This Chevelle will stop on a dime...and give you 9 cents in change
New Baer 13" front rotor track system
New Baer 11" rear rotor track system
Dash & Sound system
Dakota digital dash
901 Alpine AM/FM/6 CD changer/DVD/Stereo Amps/Bluetooth/Custom speakers.
As you might imagine, the "Monster Motor" sounds phenomenal in this car but
the Sound system in this car is pretty amazing as well and if it great Tunes you
want...just crank up the volume!
Fuel system
Custom stainless steel fuel tank/custom sending unit, braided lines,
stainless fuel lines, pre-fuel filter, fuel filter, billet performance fuel pump,
Platinum fuel regulator, billet fuel rail, 1971 Chevelle duel fuel line kit.
Power equipment
Power driver's bucket seat
Billet power steering
Power windows and door locks
Interior
Rather than list everything, we will let the photos tell everything.
The receipt for the interior is for $14,000. As comfortable as a Mercedes 600SL.
Chrome & trim
New front & rear bumpers (show quality) new grille and all new trim & emblems
Rear bumper do some some coloration from exhaust as seen in video.
Paint
In one word SPECTACULAR! The body is arrow-straight and the 2 stage PPG black
paint is like looking into a pool of black shimmering ink. It will cost you close to $20,000
to paint a car to this level of quality.
The white stripes are also gorgeous...not cheap tape...but painted on the care to perfection.
Convertible Top: (Power)
Great fitting new black top with rear glass window and a new black top boot
Miscellaneous
There are so many special things about this build that it is impossible to list everything
Just to add a few things, new wipers, new side markers, all new lights, a milled wire loom ball,
all new rubber seals, new dash, new custom steering wheel, HEI distributor, Flaming River tilt column
and steering wheel, LG button bowtie horn button, new hoses, clamps, mirrors, locking dip stick,
weather strip kit and Lojack recovery system.
Here is your choice...and it's a relatively easy one....you can search for a rust free
1970 or 1971 Chevelle convertible you can probably buy for $35,000-$40,000 and then find a quality
custom car builder who is really honest...plan on  1 1/2 to 2 years and spending at least another $150,000-$200,000
and you can duplicate this car...or buy this incredible, no expense spared, drop-dead gorgeous concurs
quality already finished and tested one for a fraction on the price.....
Call us at (954) 873-6495 and we will be happy to give you our rock bottom price...but please....
I have driven this car a couple of hundred miles on the Florida Turnpike at 75-80 mph, on I-95
as well as in heavy congested traffic. I would not hesitate to drive this car anywhere...anytime...
but not in bad weather...the car is in show condition.
I drove it with the top up and the AC on and even in traffic...this Chevelle runs nice and cool with great oil pressure.
We welcome your in person inspection or an inspection by your hired professional...you will NOT
be disappointed..if you want the BEST at a fantastic price...please don't hesitate to call us.
One last thing....how is the performance? This is not a car to give to a teenager or to anyone who doesn't
respect a spectacular car with 700+ horsepower!
A THICK book of receipts will be included with this car...thanks and best of luck

Cityview Classic Cars is proud to offer this beautiful 1969 Chevrolet Chevelle Malibu SS Tribute fore sale. This is a tribute to that you are not going to be able to to resist driving and why should you that is what it was built for. The badges on the outside may say 396 but that is not what is lurking under the hood. What is ready to be unleashed is built 454 Cubic inch crate monster that was topped with a matched kit of Edelbrock cylinder heads cam intake manifold and carb. The estimated horsepower is over 500 not too shabby. Behind that is a lightened flywheel so revs move quickly a performance clutch connects this monster engine to the Tremec 5 speed manual and the gears are controlled through a Hurst shifter. Power is then transferred to the rear end which is a GM 12 bolt unit that is factory built to handle the power. So you may be thinking with all of this power you have to be able to get it to the ground somehow well that has been thought of as well. A complete UMI tubular suspension has been put into place so this thing is going to take some corners as well. QA1 Coilovers control the front dampening and spring rate and height with lowering springs in the rear with AC Delco shocks. Braking has been upgraded as well with drilled and slotted front rotors and a more aggressive brake pads. All power by the way. You may have noticed the paint is a color you have to behold a beautiful shade of metallic blue and the perfect white accent stripe to go along with it. The chrome and stainless trim is in excellent condition as are the emblems. This is a true head turner. The interior has not gone untouched with new carpet reconditioned trim and a new headliner. This is a true gem and a true pleasure to drive and makes all of the right noises. If you would like to know more please contact us. Financing is availableVisit Cityview Classic Cars online at www.cityviewclassiccars.com to see more pictures of this vehicle or call us at 817-292-4477 today.
Chevrolet Chevelle Coupe 1971 SS Look

This beautiful Chevrolet was delivered in a deep blue metallic paint with black striping. The car also has new light metal wheels. The interior is provided with black leather and finished with several chrome details and a beautiful dashboard. The Chevelle has the original V8 engine and an automatic gearbox. Recently the engine was tuned up which makes the car drive great. The car also makes a great typical American sound.

1972 Chevrolet Chevelle
Description

This fine Chevy is a numbers matching 400 V8 1972 Chevelle.  This one comes with a Turbo 400 and a 2.73 12 Bolt Positraction rear end.  It has desirable Power Assist Steering, power Disc Brakes In Front, Astro Flo Thru Ventilation with Adjustable Dash Vents, and very desirable Vintage Air Conditioning.  AM radio with working 8 track player in dash . Safety Guard Black GM Seat Belts front and rear.  The interior is done in newer and fabulous Parchment White Strato Bucket Seats with and newer black carpets. There is a chrome driver's side Mirror plus Day/Night Rear View Mirror.  Your pulse will quicken when the Performance Tuned Dual Exhaust hits its stride. It rolls about on Billet Specialties custom 120 inch polished 5 spoke wheels and an excellent set of matched Lexan 275/35ZR20 raised white letter radials. This one is finished In Mirror GlossTuxedo Black with a White power top with matching hood and trunk stripes.
Specifications
Numbers matching 400 CID Turbo Fire V8 with Holley 750 on an Edelbrock intake
Turbohydramatic 400 with Staple Shifter
Posi 12 Bolt Rear End with 2.73 Gears
Very desirable Vintage Heat and Air
Power Steering that works smooth and easy
Power Assisted Front Disc Brakes
Finished in Tuxedo Black with white Hood and Trunk Stripes
Parchment White Strato Bucket Seats cloth with full console with storage
Factory correct Horseshoe Shifter
There is a working AM 8 track player in the dash
The Floors, Frame Rails, and Trunk Floor are all solid
20 inch Billet Specialties polished chrome custom 5 spoke Wheels
Like new Lexan P275/35ZR20 RWL Radial Tires
Detailed Engine Bay and Trunk with Mat Jack and Spare
Cowl Hood w/o induction
Excellent Chrome, Stainless, and Glass throughout
Full Dual Exhaust System with Correct Box Tips
This is a sweet Chevelle and is ready to cruise
1969 Chevrolet Chevelle SS
Description

This great Chevelle has the look you want and the power to go with it. It is an original Lemans Blue car with a 454 that has been professionally rebuilt with lots of performance goodies to make it more than a formidable force on the street or the strip.  What really makes this a pleasure to drive is working air conditioning converted to 134A coolant.  The paint is in very good condition and the interior is like new.    If you are looking for a very good looking and very fun to drive Chevy don't miss this opportunity, this body style is stunning in Lemans Blue
Features
Powerful freshly rebuilt and smooth running 454 V8
Complete Dual Exhaust with performance mufflers, and correct box Tips
Smooth Shifting Turbo 400 3 speed automatic
Fully functioning Air Conditioning converted to 134a</li?
Excellent Compression from cylinder to cylinder
Holley 750 double pumper 4V Carb on an aluminum hi-rise intake
The engine bay is show detailed and includes a huge aluminum radiator
The wheels are very nice SS 5 spokes with nearly new 245/60R15 BFG RWL Radials
Matching 5th wheel and spare in the trunk along with a fitted car cover
It comes with excellent chrome and all the stainless trim
12 Bolt Posi with 3.73 Gear Ratio for Cruising
Finished in Lemans Blue with White SS Longitudinal Stripes
The interior is finished in Black with correct buckets and full console with correct Staple Shifter
Full Aftermarket Gauge Package with Amp, Oil, and Temp and Tachometer
Factory Correct Steering Wheel
Correct AM Radio mounted in the dash
Power Front Disc and Rear Drum Brakes
Variable Ratio Power Steering
Chrome Driver's Outside Rear View Mirror with interior Day/Night
Dual Bulge SS Hood and 396 Emblems on fenders, dash, and rear black panel
Distinctive Quad Headlight Front End with SS 396 Badge
Clean and solid undercarriage on this ground up restored Chevelle SS
Here is one solid and clean big block SS in one of the most sought after colors that is ready to enjoy today

In 1970, sheetmetal revisions gave the bodies a more squared-up stance following the coke bottle styling, and interiors were also redesigned. The 1970 Chevelle shared many sheet metal body parts with the 1970 Buick Skylark GSX, both are GM automobiles and have interchangeable sheet metal. They are also the only two muscle cars to share the same roofline. The 1970 Chevelle came in sport coupe, sport sedan, convertible, four-door sedan, a couple of wagons, and coupé utility (the El Camino) body styles. Only three of these (Malibu sport coupe, Malibu convertible and El Camino pickup) were available with a choice of one of 2 SS options; RPO Z25 with the SS 396 (402 cid) engine and RPO Z15 with the new 454 cid engine. The base model was now simply called Chevelle in lieu of the former base 300 Deluxe, and was only available as a Sport Coupe or four-door sedan. In Canada, the base series retained its 300 Deluxe name, with appropriate badging on each front fender just behind the front wheel well. The hardtop, convertible, and sedan received the upgraded sheetmetal but the station wagons and El Camino retained the previous year sheetmetal panels (which went on for the next 2 model years). Station wagons were the entry level Nomad, the Chevelle level Greenbrier, the Malibu level Concours and an upscale Concours Estate. New options included power door locks and a stalk-mounted wiper control.

The SS 396 Chevelle included a 350 horsepower (260 kW) Turbo-Jet 396 V8, special suspension, ''power dome'' hood, black-accented grille, resilient rear-bumper insert, and wide-oval tires on sport wheels. Though a 375 horsepower (280 kW) cowl induction version was available, few were sold in favor of the newly introduced 454 engine during late-1969 timeframe. The LS5 454-cubic-inch V8 produced 360 horsepower (270 kW) in standard form and a cowl induction version was also available. The LS6 produced a claimed 450 gross HP in solid-lifter, high-compression guise.

''You can make our tough one even tougher,'' the brochure explained, by adding Cowl Induction to either the SS 396 or the SS 454. Step on the gas, and a scoop opened ''to shoot an extra breath of cool air into the engine air intake....like second wind to a distance runner.'' Neither functional hood lock pins nor hood and deck stripes were standard with either SS option, but were part of the optional ZL2 cowl induction hood option. The 454 cu in (7.4 L) LS5 V8 was rated at 360 hp (270 kW).
